intro: Filipendula camtschatica var. carnea, commonly known as the pink meadow sweet, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Siberia and northern China. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of pink to reddish-purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with serrated edges, and its flowers are arranged in dense, spherical inflorescences. This variant is distinguished by its showy, pinkish flowers, which contrast with the more typical white or yellow flowers of other Filipendula species.
